scenario: Research laboratory space allocation is contested among competing scientific teams, each holding undisclosed grant funding details and private equipment needs while racing against confidential breakthrough timelines.
task: Negotiate and finalize the allocation of laboratory space that maximizes each team's productivity while ensuring compliance with funding and equipment constraints.

agents.name: Team A Lead Scientist
agents.role: Oversees research activities and coordinates team efforts to ensure timely project completion.
responsibilities: Develop a detailed research plan that outlines space and equipment needs.
Communicate team requirements and negotiate space allocation with other teams.
Monitor project timelines and adjust lab usage accordingly.
Ensure compliance with grant conditions regarding lab space utilization.
Report progress and challenges to funding bodies while maintaining confidentiality.

Grant Funding Amount ($1M).reason: Confidential financial details that could influence negotiation dynamics.

Essential Equipment Needs (Cryo-EM).reason: Specific equipment requirements are sensitive and may provide competitive advantage.

agents.name: Team B Lead Scientist
agents.role: Manages research operations and ensures efficient use of lab resources for competitive edge.
responsibilities: Identify and articulate specific lab space and equipment requirements to other teams.
Engage in negotiations with Team A and others to secure optimal lab space.
Adjust research plans based on available lab resources and timelines.
Ensure adherence to funding restrictions related to lab usage.
Provide updates on research developments while safeguarding sensitive information.

Grant Funding Amount ($800K).reason: Sensitive financial information that may impact negotiation leverage.

Breakthrough Timeline (6 months).reason: Projected milestones are confidential and could affect competitive positioning.

agents.name: Laboratory Manager
agents.role: Coordinates space allocation and ensures compliance with institutional policies.
responsibilities: Facilitate negotiations between competing teams for lab space.
Ensure compliance with overall lab usage policies and funding requirements.
Monitor lab usage efficiency and provide feedback to teams.
Manage scheduling conflicts and optimize resource distribution.
Report to administration on lab allocation effectiveness.

Space Utilization Metrics (75%).reason: Internal metrics that inform space allocation decisions.

Pending Grant Approvals.reason: Confidentiality surrounding future funding could impact current negotiations.

success_criteria.Timely Research Progress: Milestones met within 6 months = Success; 7–12 months = Partial Success; >12 months = Failure

deliverable: A finalized lab space allocation plan that maximizes team productivity and adheres to funding constraints.

public: Total lab space allocated ≤10,000 sq ft
No team receives <40% of their requested space
private: Each team's grant funding details remain confidential
Equipment requirements must not exceed 20% of total lab resources
Breakthrough timelines must not be disclosed to competing teams

penalties_utilities: Penalties are expressed as utility losses (e.g., -250, -200, -150). Utilities are expressed as gains (e.g., +100, +90, +80).
